title: Attack speed

properties.name: description
properties.value: Attack speed is determined by the interval between hits. Hit intervals are measured in game ticks (0.6 seconds). The lower the interval, the faster the attack speed.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Attack rate

Attack speed is determined by the interval between hits. Hit intervals are measured in game ticks (0.6 seconds). The lower the interval, the faster the attack speed.

The attack speed can not be altered by any consumables, rather it is determined by the type of weapon being used. The tables below show the attack speeds for the respective types.

The speed of all combat spells is 5 (3.0 seconds). Powered staves and the Harmonised nightmare staff have an attack speed of 4 (2.4 seconds).

Contents

  • 1 Weapon attack speeds
    • 1.1 Melee weapons
    • 1.2 Special melee weapons
    • 1.3 Ranged weapons
    • 1.4 Special ranged weapons
  • 2 Monster attack speeds

Monster attack speeds[edit | edit source]

The attack speed of a monster determines the rate of attack of a monster in certain situations. This is a factor which balances the attacking power of a monster.

The speeds of monsters are represented by a bar on which there are several possible values ranging from 1 (fastest) to 15 (slowest), with each value added having an extra tick before they attack.

Speed Interval Examples Notes
1 Scarab swarm, Pestilent Bloat Hits low, but often. Scarab swarms can poison.
2 Killerwatt, Thermonuclear smoke devil, Rock lobster, Commander Zilyana Attacks every other tick, and generally tends to have high accuracy, albeit usually low damage.
3 Flesh Crawler, Kree'arra Tends to hit lower than most monsters, but with more accuracy.
4 Most bare-handed monsters, including bare-handed humans, Dark wizards, Goblins, Hobgoblins The most common monster attack speed. Many use melee attacks.
5 Humans holding weapons with attack speed 5, zombies holding weapons, dwarves, Revenants, Guthan the Infested, Torag the Corrupted, Verac the Defiled Tends to hit harder and more accurately than monsters of similar level.
6 Giants, humans wielding crossbows, General Graardor, Ahrim the Blighted, K'ril Tsutsaroth Hits are fairly slow, but tend to be quite accurate and damaging.
7 White Knight, Dharok the Wretched, Black knight titan, TzKal-Zuk (enraged), Verzik Vitur (final form) Very slow attack rate, but hits tend to be very accurate and hard.
8 Dad, TzTok-Jad, Nail beasts Extremely slow, but generally heavily damaging attacks. Nail beasts cause three separate hits in a single attack.
9 JalTok-Jad
10 Head (Temple Trekking), H.A.M. Archer, TzKal-Zuk, The Maiden of Sugadinti
12 Giant mosquito
15 Scarab mage
Varies Cave horror, Elvarg, Melzar the Mad, Monk of Zamorak, Tolna, Stranger These monsters hit with varied speed - some depending on their attack style.
